content.title: Scheme for Margin Money Grant to Nano Units
content.department: Directorate of Industries and Commerce, Government of Kerala
content.beneficiary: Nano units in manufacturing, job work, and service activity
content.details: The scheme 'Margin Money Grant to Nano Units' is a loan-linked scheme aimed at providing financial assistance to Nano units in Kerala engaged in various activities with value addition. It promotes deserving entrepreneurs to set up Nano enterprises through Margin Money loans.
benefits: Units with project costs up to ₹10 Lakhs will be covered in the scheme.
Margin Money Grant of 30% to 40% of the Total Project cost according to the category of the applicant.
Women, Youth (Age between 18 and 40), Differentially-Abled Persons, Ex-Servicemen, and persons belonging to the SC/ST category will be eligible for a 10% additional Grant.
The maximum limit of margin money grant under the scheme shall be ₹4 lakhs per unit.
eligibility: All new Nano proprietary enterprises in manufacturing/food processing and job works and units engaged in the service sector having any type of value addition, whose project cost includes fixed capital and working capital up to ₹10 lakhs are eligible for assistance under the scheme.
The unit shall not have availed any grant assistance earlier under any schemes of the Government of India & Government of Kerala or Local Self Government Department.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Application can be submitted online through the Official website of the Directorate of Industries & Commerce, Government of Kerala.
documents_required: Title Deed of Land/ Land Tax Receipt if applicable
Ownership Certificate of the building if applicable
Registered Lease Deed or Rent Deed in such cases
Proforma Invoice/Quotation of plant, machinery and electrification
Valuation of approved Engineer, Chartered Engineer for Civil Construction
Sanction letter from financial institution/Bank if any
Any other document as demanded by the recommending/sanctioning authority

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Nano units in the State, engaged in manufacturing, job work, and service activity having any type of value addition.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to promote/incentivize deserving entrepreneurs in setting up Nano enterprises within the State through Margin Money loans to Nano units for loan-linked projects.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Industries & Commerce Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Which types of enterprises are eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: All new Nano proprietary enterprises in manufacturing/food processing and job works and units engaged in the service sector having any type of value addition, whose project cost includes fixed capital and working capital up to ₹10 lakhs are eligible for assistance under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Margin Money Grant of 30% to 40% of the Total Project cost according to the category of the applicant will be provided under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the maximum limit of the margin money grant under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum limit of margin money grant under the scheme shall be ₹4 lakhs per unit.

faqs.question: How shall assistance be released to the eligible entrepreneur?
faqs.answer: The assistance under the scheme shall be released to the eligible entrepreneur by bank on a pro-rata basis.

faqs.question: Will a unit/enterprise be eligible if it has availed any grant assistance earlier under any schemes?
faqs.answer: No, the unit shall not have availed any grant assistance earlier under any schemes of the Government of India & Government of Kerala or Local Self Government Department.

faqs.question: Who will be given preference in this scheme?
faqs.answer: Preference is given to special categories such as youth entrepreneurs up to the age of 40, women, handicapped persons, ex-servicemen, and persons belonging to SC/ST.

faqs.question: How much will the additional grant be given to the special category?
faqs.answer: Women, Youth (Age between 18 and 40), Differentially-Abled Persons, Ex-Servicemen, and persons belonging to the SC/ST category will be eligible for a 10% additional Grant.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Application can be submitted online through the Official website of the Directorate of Industries & Commerce, Government of Kerala.
